qas.question: How are international businesses discouraged from operating in Burma?

answers.text: Sanctions imposed by the United States and European countries against the former military government, coupled with boycotts

qas.question: What was the result for internationals companies attempting to conduct business in Burma ?

answers.text: the withdrawal from the country of most US and many European companies

qas.question: Who called for the sanctions in Burma to be given reprieve ?
What did Aung San Suu Kyi become a part of in Burma ?

context: <a0_0>Sanctions imposed by the United States and European countries against the former military government, coupled with boycotts<a0_0/> and other direct pressure on corporations by supporters of the democracy movement, have resulted in <a1_0>the withdrawal from the country of most US and many European companies<a1_0/>. On 13 April 2012 <a2_0>British Prime Minister David Cameron<a2_0/> called for the economic sanctions on Myanmar to be suspended in the wake of the pro-democracy party gaining 43 seats out of a possible 45 in the 2012 by-elections with the party leader, Aung San Suu Kyi becoming a member of <a3_0>the Burmese parliament<a3_0/>.
